ticket.title: sqlite missing ddl transactions and savepoints
ticket.original-body:
The sqlite adapter is out of date regarding ddl transactions and savepoint support. This patch updates it.
Hard for you guys to confirm, so I have the forum post from drh[1] where he states when DDL support in transactions came into sqlite, and the commit history of sqlite[2] showing when savepoints arrived.
[1] http://tinyurl.com/sqlite-v2-0-0 [2] http://tinyurl.com/sqlite-v3-6-8
ticket.latest-body:

[1] http://tinyurl.com/sqlite-v2-0-0 [2] http://tinyurl.com/sqlite-v3-6-8

The sqlite adapter is out of date regarding ddl transactions and savepoint support. This patch updates it.

Hard for you guys to confirm, so I have the forum post from drh[1] where he states when DDL support in transactions came into sqlite, and the commit history of sqlite[2] showing when savepoints arrived.

version.body:
The sqlite adapter is out of date regarding ddl transactions and savepoint support. This patch updates it.
Hard for you guys to confirm, so I have [the forum post from drh](http://tinyurl.com/sqlite-v2-0-0) where he states when DDL support in transactions came into sqlite, and [the commit history of sqlite](http://tinyurl.com/sqlite-v3-6-8) showing when savepoints arrived.
version.body-html:
The sqlite adapter is out of date regarding ddl transactions and savepoint support. This patch updates it.

Hard for you guys to confirm, so I have the forum post from drh where he states when DDL support in transactions came into sqlite, and the commit history of sqlite showing when savepoints arrived.
version.title: sqlite missing ddl transactions and savepoints

version.body: Just noticed another bug in the existing version comparisons. Attaching a new patch including both changesets.
version.body-html: Just noticed another bug in the existing version comparisons. Attaching a new patch including both changesets.
version.title: sqlite missing ddl transactions and savepoints

version.body:
(from [38136f86dc5504bde94dc7399d4a854023d7481f]) DDL transactions and savepoints for sqlite
Sqlite has had DDL transactions since 2.0.0[1] and savepoints since 3.6.8[2]. This patch updates the connection_adapters.
[1] http://tinyurl.com/sqlite-v2-0-0 [2] http://tinyurl.com/sqlite-v3-6-8
Signed-off-by: Michael Koziarski <michael@koziarski.com> [#2080 state:committed] http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/38136f86dc5504bde94dc7399d4a854023d7481f
version.body-html:
(from [38136f86dc5504bde94dc7399d4a854023d7481f]) DDL transactions and savepoints for sqlite

Sqlite has had DDL transactions since 2.0.0[1] and savepoints since 3.6.8[2]. This patch updates the connection_adapters.

[1] http://tinyurl.com/sqlite-v2-0-0 [2] http://tinyurl.com/sqlite-v3-6-8

Signed-off-by: Michael Koziarski michael@koziarski.com [#2080 state:committed] http://github.com/rails/rails/co...
version.title: sqlite missing ddl transactions and savepoints

version.body:
(from [818556ec4f237b19f28fdecdfe6037718cceba37]) Revert "DDL transactions and savepoints for sqlite"
This reverts commit 38136f86dc5504bde94dc7399d4a854023d7481f.
Caused several test failures on the ci box:
http://ci.rubyonrails.org/builds/rails/38136f [#2080 state:open] http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/818556ec4f237b19f28fdecdfe6037718cceba37
version.body-html:
(from [818556ec4f237b19f28fdecdfe6037718cceba37]) Revert "DDL transactions and savepoints for sqlite"

This reverts commit 38136f86dc5504bde94dc7399d4a854023d7481f.

Caused several test failures on the ci box:

http://ci.rubyonrails.org/builds... [#2080 state:open] http://github.com/rails/rails/co...
version.title: sqlite missing ddl transactions and savepoints

version.body:
Fixed.
I hadn't run the tests, but have now. All fixed to take account of the old VACUUM call in add_column which was preventing it from being wrapped in a transaction.
version.body-html:
Fixed.

I hadn't run the tests, but have now. All fixed to take account of the old VACUUM call in add_column which was preventing it from being wrapped in a transaction.
version.title: sqlite missing ddl transactions and savepoints

version.body:
Not sure if I was meant to assign this to you Michael. I haven't seen any action on it, and wanted to make sure it doesn't slip off the plate.
It's a good patch that will give sqlite3 users an important boost - especially for migrations.
version.body-html:
Not sure if I was meant to assign this to you Michael. I haven't seen any action on it, and wanted to make sure it doesn't slip off the plate.

It's a good patch that will give sqlite3 users an important boost - especially for migrations.
version.title: sqlite missing ddl transactions and savepoints

version.body:
Yeah, you were meant to assign it to me :)
@@@ - def supports_count_distinct? #:nodoc: - false - end @@@
Why did you remove that?
version.body-html:
Yeah, you were meant to assign it to me :)


-      def supports_count_distinct? #:nodoc:
-        false
-      end

Why did you remove that?
version.title: sqlite missing ddl transactions and savepoints

version.body:
Because this is in SQLiteAdapter which SQLite2Adapter inherits from:
@@@ruby def supports_count_distinct? #:nodoc: sqlite_version >= '3.2.6' end @@@@
Which made it redundant in SQLite2Adapter.
version.body-html:
Because this is in SQLiteAdapter which SQLite2Adapter inherits from:

@@@ruby def supports_count_distinct? #:nodoc: sqlite_version >= '3.2.6' end @@@@

Which made it redundant in SQLite2Adapter.
version.title: sqlite missing ddl transactions and savepoints

version.body:
Oops:
@@@ ruby def supports_count_distinct? #:nodoc: sqlite_version >= '3.2.6' end @@@
version.body-html:
Oops:


def supports_count_distinct? #:nodoc:
  sqlite_version >= '3.2.6'
end
version.title: sqlite missing ddl transactions and savepoints

version.body: Ok, I give up :)
version.body-html: Ok, I give up :)
version.title: sqlite missing ddl transactions and savepoints

version.body: The patch should also modify migration_test.rb#test_migrator_one_up_with_exception_and_rollback for testing that with sqlite adapters supporting ddl transactions.
